episodes.title: Is YOUR Political Party Culty?
episodes.description: After spending over 10 years in a cult, I became obsessed with recognizing the patterns. And now? I see them everywhere—especially in our political tribes. Everyone's busy calling the other side a cult while refusing to examine their own behavior. In this episode of WTF is on my Mind?!, I'm asking you to do something uncomfortable: question YOUR side. Not theirs. YOURS. Using “The Village” by M. Night Shyamalan as a metaphor, I break down how echo chambers work, how we justify our worst behavior, and why both sides think only the OTHER guys have been captured by extremists. Here's the test: if you're listening to this thinking "yeah, but MY side is different" - you may have proved my point. This isn't about left vs right. It's about recognizing when you've stopped thinking and started defending. When accountability becomes shunning. When influence becomes coercion. When you're so convinced you're fighting Nazis that you can't see your own reflection and everything becomes an option, including violence. I went through this humbling. It was the best thing I ever did. And thousands of people are doing it right now—waking up and realizing what they believed was deranged. Are you brave enough to look? If this video made you uncomfortable, good. Share it with someone who needs to hear this. And if you're angry at me right now, I get it. Just ask yourself why. episodes.title: Narcissistic Abuse is like Radiation Poisoning
episodes.description: What if narcissistic abuse doesn't show up right away… but builds up like radiation in the body—silent, invisible, & devastating over time? In this solo episode, recorded from Cape Town, I reflect on family lineage, legacy, & the long-term effects of being around narcissists—especially the malignant kind. Inspired by a visit to my family's grave site, I look at how the effects of unresolved pathology gets passed down through generations… & how it quietly shapes our choices, fears, & dreams (or lack of them). We've been way too focused on diagnosing the 'radioactive substance.' But what about the people slowly getting poisoned just by being in its presence? 00:00 – Intro from Cape Town 00:27 – Visiting my grandparents' graves 01:06 – Legacy, lineage, & what gets passed down 02:09 – NPD & its impact on the family system 03:25 – Radiation as a metaphor for narcissistic abuse 05:01 – The suppressed life force of survivors 06:35 – How narcissists train people to fear their own essence 07:57 – Why I left South Africa (and my middle finger) 09:01 – You can't always treat the narcissist—but you can protect people 10:08 – Radiation poisoning at the societal level 11:23 – From families to corporations: the scale of the damage 11:51 – Outro + podcast mention Check out my other podcast, 'Remember Your Greatness' https://www.youtube.com/@UCHUIodar-kbyUr0rmst2j1g

episodes.title: Are Narcissists Born or Made? w/ Dr  Peter Salerno
episodes.description: In this episode of WTF is on My Mind?!, I sit down with Dr. Peter Salerno — a retired psychotherapist and author who has spent decades studying personality disorders, psychopathy, and complex trauma. Our conversation dives straight into one of the most heated debates in psychology: are narcissists shaped by trauma and upbringing, or are some people simply born with traits that evolve into full-blown disorders? Dr. Salerno challenges the conventional belief that all narcissism stems from childhood wounds, pointing to research in genetics and neuroscience that shows a far more complicated picture. We also unpack his concept of “traumatic cognitive dissonance” — the paralyzing confusion survivors experience when an abuser deliberately installs contradictory realities in their minds. It’s not just internal conflict; it’s an engineered state of disorientation that keeps people stuck in toxic relationships and systems of control. From there, the discussion widens: we explore how support groups can restore a shattered sense of reality, why some people lose touch with their identity after abuse, and what it really takes to rebuild a self when you were never given the space to form one in the first place. We also look at narcissistic emptiness, the myth of the “hidden shame,” and why grandiosity — not insecurity — may actually be the engine driving narcissistic behavior. The conversation doesn’t stay confined to therapy rooms. We talk about the ways these dynamics show up in society at large — from political polarization to media manipulation — and how it all echoes the same psychological warfare found in abusive relationships. This was a fascinating and unsettling deep dive into human psychology, which left me with a whole new lens on abuse, personality, and power. episodes.title: Mind Mapping Insanity: How Cults Normalize Madness
episodes.description: In this episode of WTF is On My Mind?!, filmmaker and whistleblower Mark Vicente explores what happens when we try to understand an irrational or dangerous mind. Whether it’s a cult leader, an abuser, or the mainstream media—attempting to “map” insanity can destabilize one’s own sanity. Brain Talk: How Mind Mapping Brain Science Can Change Your Life & Everyone In It - by David Schnarch Mark unpacks the concept of mind mapping—our brain’s instinct to model the thoughts and intentions of others—and shows how it becomes distorted in high-control environments. Drawing from his experience inside NXIVM, he reflects on: The hyper-vigilance around Keith Raniere. The split between a “cult self” and the real self. The chaos of “spaghetti brain” when irrational behavior is normalized. But this is more than just a story about cults. Mark connects these patterns to everyday life, revealing: How media propaganda and lies mimic cult indoctrination. Why truth-tellers are often branded “extremists.” The cost of normalizing hypocrisy, duplicity, and deception as “business as usual.” At its core, the episode is about the hidden psychological toll of mapping madness—and why feeling disturbed may actually be the sanest response to the world right now. Warning: This episode discusses trauma, coercive control, psychological abuse, and systemic deception. Viewer discretion advised. The conversation continues on PATREON, where Mark is able to speak fully and uncensored about the issues Skynet… uhhh… certain platforms won’t allow. episodes.title: You’re Dead to Me - Shunning as Social Control
episodes.description:
In this episode of WTF Is On My Mind?!, Mark Vicente pulls back the curtain on one of the most insidious tools of social control: shunning — not just as a personal act of rejection, but as a systemic, psychological weapon masquerading as moral high ground.

This isn’t just about cults. It’s about how cult behavior has gone mainstream — how families, political factions, media outlets, and activist circles now use public exile and cold silence to punish dissent and demand conformity. Drawing on a recent New York Times opinion piece that unintentionally exposes the creeping logic of ideological purity, Mark examines the difference between healthy boundaries and coercive exile, between critical thinking and performative allegiance.

He also reflects on his own experience inside NXIVM, where shunning was formal doctrine — and how eerily familiar those same dynamics look in our current cultural climate. From mocking deaths to cutting off loved ones for their beliefs, we’re in dangerous territory when belonging becomes conditional on orthodoxy — be it political, medical, or spiritual.

But all is not doom and gloom. This episode also looks at how the spell can break — how real human connection, outside the algorithms and echo chambers, can restore our capacity for nuance, empathy, and even disagreement without destruction.

Mark’s take is blunt, piercing, and layered with lived experience — and it just might make you think twice about who’s really being “cultish.”

episodes.title: Epstein, Political Blackmail & Why No One’s Coming to Save Us!
episodes.description:
What happens when people finally see through the lies? Mark Vicente breaks down the Epstein cover-up, government blackmail operations, and why we can't wait for heroes to save us. Mark connects the dots between cult dynamics and political power structures, drawing from his experience as a NXIVM whistleblower.

The Epstein Cover-Up and What It Really Means: Mark digs into why the official narrative around Epstein's death and the missing client list feels so transparently false. But here's the twist: those blatant lies aren't meant to convince you or me. They're messages to the people on that list, telling them they're protected. When you understand that intelligence agencies need leverage over powerful people, the whole honey trap operation starts making sense. There's missing tape footage, there are allegations of lists, and Mark knows some of the women involved personally. This isn't conspiracy theory territory anymore.

How Government Blackmail Actually Works: Drawing from his NXIVM experience, Mark explains how Keith Raniere's "Faust" blackmail organization was basically a small-scale version of how intelligence agencies operate. Raniere didn't invent this shit, he learned it from somewhere. When attorneys general or presidents want to prosecute something and suddenly back down with flimsy excuses, Mark wonders: did they get a phone call? A visit? Maybe a threat against their family? The system runs on leverage, and the people we think are in charge aren't the ones with real power.

Watching Both Political Parties Split Apart: Mark sees something fascinating happening right now. The Israel-Palestine issue has bifurcated the Democratic Party. The Epstein cover-up is splitting Republicans. Both sides are fracturing because people are finally seeing through the cult-like thinking that says you have to support your leader no matter what they do. It looks chaotic, but Mark thinks this is actually what happens when cults collapse. People start questioning everything and referring back to their own moral compass instead of blindly following.

Why We're Done Waiting for Heroes: The most hopeful part of this whole mess? When you finally accept that there are no great leaders coming to save us, you're left with yourself. Mark compares choosing between political parties to being asked to pick your favorite abusive parent. Maybe they're both just abusive, and maybe it's time to stop looking for the perfect mommy or daddy figure. The legendary people from the movies aren't in politics. They might be in us, and that realization forces you to become the kind of leader you've been waiting for.

Mentioned in This Episode:
Whitney Webb - "One Nation Under Blackmail"
Eric Weinstein on media narratives
Frank Parlato and his anti-NXIVM blog

episodes.title: 40 Years Under His Spell: Waking Up from NXIVM
episodes.description: In this deeply intimate conversation, Mark sits down with his old friend Karen Unterreiner — a woman who spent 4 decades at the epicenter of what the world came to know as NXIVM. Once a high-ranking member, deeply entangled both professionally & personally with Keith Raniere, Karen shares her long journey of waking up from psychological captivity. What does it mean to have your entire adult identity shaped by someone else's manipulative design? How do you start to rebuild a self when that self was never fully yours to begin with? Karen & Mark dive into the mechanics of grooming, the slow erosion of boundaries, & the double binds that kept people loyal. They unpack the devastating misuse of 'ethics' as a weapon, the shame loops that silenced dissent, & the emotional landmines survivors navigate when they begin to deprogram. episodes.title: The Cult of Weaponized Introspection
episodes.description: In this expletive laden & unfiltered solo episode, Mark Vicente dives deep into the subtle, insidious ways abusive individuals & systems exploit our longing to grow, reflect, & 'be better.' He explores the psychological unraveling that happens when introspection is hijacked to suppress personal agency. Drawing from his lived experience in NXIVM, Mark unpacks how coercive groups often encourage relentless self-examination not to empower, but to disable. The more you question yourself, the less you question them. He shares how terms like 'narcissism on a spectrum' & 'interdependence' are weaponized to gaslight dissent & justify control—especially over sensitive, self-aware individuals. The episode also takes aim at the modern digital landscape, where platforms like YouTube reward hysteria, obedience, & superficiality while shadowbanning nuanced, divergent voices. Mark wrestles with a painful dilemma: should he tailor his messaging to appease the algorithm gods—or remain steadfastly authentic & risk invisibility? This is a reflection on the price of truth, the cost of being 'too sensitive,' & the mind games that keep good people doubting themselves while abusers thrive. Themes Explored: • Weaponized introspection & the psychology of disempowerment • Narcissistic abuse vs. healthy self-assertion • False narratives around 'everyone's a narcissist' • Coercive control in high-control groups • The trap of endless personal responsibility • Digital censorship, shadow-banning & algorithmic obedience • The tension between authenticity & visibility in online spaces The views & opinions expressed on WTF is on my Mind?! do not necessarily reflect the official policy or position of the podcast or Mark Vicente. episodes.title: They Mimic Us
episodes.description:
High-functioning predators don’t emote like the rest of us. No joy. No fear. No empathy. What they do feel is entitlement—and a cold, calculated rage when their control is threatened.

They study us. Mimic us. Some even use religion to learn how to perform being human. But it’s all a facade—crafted to manipulate, control, and dominate.

In the latest episode of WTF is on My Mind?!, I sit down with Dr. Karen Mitchell to explore what makes these dark personalities so dangerously effective—and so hard to spot.

This isn’t just narcissism. It’s something far more covert—and far more chilling.

episodes.title: Dignity, Trauma, Google Gods, Archeology and ‘Truth’ in a MAD World
episodes.description: In this solo episode, filmmaker & truth-seeker Mark Vicente shares what's been stirring in his mind—from the deeply personal to the culturally explosive. He starts with an exploration of dignity—what it is, why it matters, & how it's the missing ingredient in many conversations about boundaries & self-respect. Through stories & personal insight, he dives into the internal work required to reclaim one's worth, especially after experiences of coercive control, narcissistic abuse, or cult entanglement. Mark also challenges the idea that we can simply 'move on' from trauma. Drawing from his conversations with cult survivors, he shares why unprocessed pain never truly stays buried—and how it inevitably seeps into our relationships, our bodies, & our choices if left unhealed. Then things take a turn: he unpacks recent archaeological discoveries beneath the Pyramid of Khafre using SAR (Synthetic Aperture Radar) scans—findings that seem to confirm the theories long ridiculed as 'conspiracies.' He calls out the mainstream resistance to new truths, especially when they disrupt long-held narratives. This leads into a passionate reflection on shadowbanning, censorship, & algorithmic suppression—including what appears to be a deliberate silencing of a previous podcast episode featuring a Black female guest whose voice, ironically, challenges the very systems that claim to protect marginalized voices. Lastly, Mark questions what we even mean when we say 'the world.' Is it the real world—or the carefully filtered version we've been fed through screens, algorithms, & corporate media? This episode is messy, real, & deeply human. It's not about having answers—it's about asking better questions. If you've ever felt like the world's gone mad, this one's for you. episodes.title: What is CONSENT? Does Yes mean YES?
episodes.description: In this episode: I talk to 2 incredible women who are leading the charge to redefine how we think about & legislate consent—Joyce Short & Nina Lucas of the Consent Awareness Network, or CAN. If Joyce Short gets her way, both 'Yes Means Yes' & 'No Means No' will be stricken from our laws. She is a sexual assault survivor & the author of 4 books that can turn our human right to consent into a civil right backed by law. She is the founder & Chief Executive of the Consent Awareness Network & a TEDx Talk Presenter. She has been an expert witness & the architect of several legislative bills that can radically change how our justice system deals with consent. Joyce has been featured on Nightline, CBS News, BuzzFeed, Inside Edition, the NY Times, & more, & she's been quoted in books & journals, including 'The Moment' by Andrea Constand, & has been honored as a 'Woman of Distinction' by the NY State Assembly. Nina Lucas serves as Chief of Staff & a Consent Outreach Ambassador for the Consent Awareness Network (CAN). She is also an activist with Never Alone Advocacy, founded to fight back against abuse of power in the military. As a classically trained singer, Nina's secret superpower is opera & she is dedicated to applying her robust voice to inform, educate & empower however she can in all efforts to #CodifyConsent WEBSITE: http://www.consentawareness.net Joyce's TEDx TALK: https://bit.ly/DefineConsent Joyce's Book: Your Consent: The Key to Conquering Sexual Assault (revised edition): https://bit.ly/ConsentRevised ACTION ITEM - SIGN THE PETITION: https://bit.ly/BillPetition DONATE: https://consentawareness.net/donate/ OTHER CULT/CONSENT podcast appearances: A Little Bit Culty Something Was Wrong CONTACT US: https://bit.ly/ConsentAmbassador #FGKIA - freely given, knowledgeable informed agreement (by a person with the capacity to reason) #CodifyConsent The views & opinions expressed on WTF is on my Mind?! do not necessarily reflect the official policy or position of the podcast or Mark Vicente. I also explore how this same kind of gaslighting happens beyond cults – in politics, social movements, and even everyday life, when we stay loyal to our "team" at the cost of our own moral compass. It’s about confronting the uncomfortable questions and staying curious, no matter where you find yourself. 00:00 - Intro Teaser: Are We the Baddies? I begin with the question no one wants to ask but must: “Are we doing something wrong?” This sets the stage for a deeper look into avoiding moral questioning. 02:00 - Alison Mack’s Story Alison Mack once questioned her role in NXIVM, but Raniere manipulated her into doubting herself, a classic gaslighting move to keep her compliant. 04:30 - Gaslighting in NXIVM Raniere’s tactic of framing questions as selfish behavior stopped people from critically thinking about the organization and its practices. 06:15 - Cult-Like Behavior in Society I discuss how this same tactic plays out in broader society, where groups refuse to question themselves and silence internal doubts. 08:00 - Fragmentation in Cults I reflect on a high-ranking NXIVM member who, under years of manipulation, became disconnected from reality, but no one dared to question her. 10:00 - Blind Loyalty in Groups I explore how group loyalty, in both cults and politics, can lead people to defend actions they would normally find immoral. 12:00 - Denial of Evil I discuss how people deny or justify real issues, like child trafficking, simply because the "enemy" points them out. 13:45 - Defending Processed Food I reflect on how processed food has become defended by some, not because it’s healthy, but because the opposing side says it’s bad. 15:00 - Cults and Psychosis I emphasize the need for self-reflection to avoid falling into cult-like thinking, where group loyalty overrides personal values. 17:00 - Questioning Your Own Side I encourage viewers to challenge their own group when wrongdoing is evident, even if it means facing backlash. 18:00 - Final Thoughts: Stay Curious I end with a reminder to always stay curious, keep questioning, and avoid falling into blind loyalty or groupthink. Let's keep the conversation going and strive for more meaningful exchanges. episodes.title: The Rage of the 'Empaths'
episodes.description: The Dangers of Intolerance: Culty Behavior in Today's World In this episode, I delve into the unsettling parallels between cult behavior and the current climate of intolerance we see online and in society. Drawing from my experiences as a whistleblower against NXIVM and my understanding of manipulative dynamics, I explore how rigid ideologies and "thought policing" mirror the very patterns of control used by cults. Key Points Discussed: Cults and Boundaries: How cult leaders establish unspoken rules and boundaries, making members fearful of stepping outside them. Ethics Police: The role of "ethics police" in cults and how similar behaviors are emerging in the digital age, with individuals scrutinizing who others follow or what they say online. Toxic Empathy: The concept of "toxic empathy," where well-meaning individuals abandon true empathy in favor of aggressively enforcing their ideological beliefs. Labeling and Censorship: How modern-day label makers and censorship reflect cult-like mechanisms to control thought and silence dissent. The Importance of Curiosity: Encouraging open-mindedness and empathy as antidotes to the growing societal tendency to shut down differing perspectives. Join me as I unpack these crucial issues and encourage a more thoughtful and open approach to navigating complexity. 01:00 Recognizing the Patterns of Abuse in Cults 03:58 The Power of Label Makers in Shaping Public Opinion 09:10 The Importance of Curiosity, Open-Mindedness, and Empathy 14:49 The Dangers of Censorship and Silencing Opposing Viewpoints 19:39 Embracing Diversity of Thought Support the Show. episodes.title: A.I. & the Hollywood Collapse? w/ Adam G. Simon
episodes.description: In this episode: I continue my discussion with Producer/Writer Adam G. Simon - about A.I. this time. We look at the ethical implications of A.I. and the lack of regulations and ethical constraints in its development. Adam discusses the state of Hollywood, describing it as a corrupt industry driven by money and power. He explores the impact of A.I. on storytelling and expresses his worries about the loss of creativity and the homogenization of content. We discuss Nolan A.I. - a creative tool that empowers writers and filmmakers by providing co-writing, coverage, and deliverable creation features. It focuses on the individual creator's style and ideas, rather than relying on pre-existing works. Adam asserts that this particular A.I. is designed to enhance creativity and provide objective feedback, eliminating biases and nepotism often found in the industry. It allows creators to retain control over their work and bypass traditional gatekeepers. The goal is to put the power back in the hands of creatives and disrupt the current education and production systems. However, we always need to be mindful of the ethical use of A.I. and the potential for it to be misused by those in power. episodes.title: From the Mormon Church to the Cult of Hollywood w/ Adam G. Simon
episodes.description: In this episode: I talk to Adam G. Simon, a screenwriter, producer, and actor. We discuss Adam's background as a bodyguard and close protection specialist, his experiences in the Mormon Church, and his journey of leaving the church. We also touch on the investigations department within the church and the control it exerts over its members. We explore themes of abuse, manipulation, and the fear of leaving a religious community. Adam discusses his journey from Mormonism to questioning and leaving the church. He talks about the indoctrination he experienced as a child and the fear-based teachings about God. We also explore propaganda and how it is prevalent in various aspects of society, including politics and intelligence operations. Adam emphasizes the importance of questioning and critical thinking in order to see through the lies and manipulation. He reflects on his journey as a filmmaker and the challenges he has faced in the industry. Adam discusses the importance of creating his own content and owning it, rather than acquiescing to the powers that be in Hollywood. He also explores the cult-like nature of the entertainment industry, highlighting the propaganda and manipulation that exists within it. 00:00 Intro 03:11 Adam's Background as a Bodyguard and Close Protection Specialist 13:06 The Investigations Department within the Mormon Church 27:22 Discovering Abuse and Questioning the Church 36:43 Leaving the Church and Facing the Consequences 38:36 Indoctrination and Fear-based Teachings 43:09 Questioning and Leaving the Church 44:08 Recognizing Patterns of Propaganda 47:30 The Power of Questioning and Critical Thinking 52:22 Finding Truth and Authenticity 01:19:25 Creating Your Own Content and Owning It 01:33:20 The Cult-Like Nature of the Entertainment Industry 01:44:12 Valuing Life and Personal Relationships 01:50:42 Favorite Films: 'The Grey,' 'Man on Fire,' and 'Blade Runner' Support the Show. episodes.description: In this episode: A conversation with Professor of Evolutionary Psychology, Edward Dutton. We cover a wide range of topics, including the seminar on Narcissistic Psychopathy we just completed, the background of Professor Dutton, discussions on autism, the concept of heresy, controversial views, the adaptive nature of religion, and the influence of intelligence on manipulation and societal dynamics. The conversation delves into the societal shift towards dogma, the psychology of giving power to psychopathic leaders, and the departure from scientific reality. It explores the evolutionary basis for group behaviour, the impact of belief in lies on mental health, and the historical patterns of societal dogmas. We also touch on the association between traditional religiousness and mental health, as well as the impact of conformity to current beliefs on anxiety. episodes.title: STAY DAMAGED with comedian Rob Van Vuuren (aka Namaste Bae)
episodes.description: In this episode: I interview Rob van Vuuren, a comedian and actor known for his character Namaste Bae. We discuss the origins of the character, the comedy scene in South Africa, and the dangers of certainty and cult-like behavior. Rob shares how he uses comedy to process the absurdity and insanity of everyday life. We also touch on the global appeal of alternative healing and the importance of vulnerability in comedy. Rob discusses his experiences as an artist and comedian, particularly in relation to his character Namaste Bae. He talks about the challenges of creating content and the interesting questions that arise about how people perceive his character. He also discusses the cathartic nature of comedy and the importance of empathy in connecting with audiences. https://www.instagram.com/robvanvuuren/ https://linktr.ee/robvanvuuren Rob's stand-up comedy show: After wildly successful national and international tours and winning the Gold Standard Bank Ovation Award at the National Arts Festival 2023, Namaste Bae: Blessings and Kombucha is back. A healing ceremony unlike any you’ve ever experienced brought to you by the new age satirical guru taking social media by storm. Some say he was born with a bottle of kombucha in one hand and a yoga mat in the other during a Vedic Shadow Planet eclipse. Some say he takes all the psychedelics so you don’t have to. Some say he is still looking for a ticket to Burning Man. Whatever they say, Namaste Bae is the guru you both need and deserve. A self proclaimed oracle of the Mother Scoby, Namaste Bae will help you find yourself inside yourself and with the power of comedic catharsis he will help you give birth to a better version of yourself. Namaste Bae is the globally viral brainchild of multi-award winning South African comedian and actor Rob van Vuuren, and will provide you with a night of healing hilarity and titillating transcendence you won’t forget! episodes.title: The Goodness Trap
episodes.description: Send us a Text Message. In this episode: I discuss the concept of the goodness trap, where people become so attached to the idea of being good that they ignore or justify bad behavior. I explore how this trap can be seen in various contexts, such as political extremism, cults, and the protection of institutions. I also highlight the danger of virtue signaling and the need for individuals to critically examine their own ideological teams and actions. episodes.title: BRAINWASHED! - with Behavioural Scientist and Author Patrick Fagan
episodes.description: Author, Lecturer & Behavioural Scientist Patrick Fagan and I delve into the topics of brainwashing, propaganda, manipulation, and the impact of psychological tactics on behaviour. We explore the influence of communication, media, and societal forces on individuals, as well as the role of trauma and vulnerability in susceptibility to manipulation. The discussion also touches on the concept of the 'blip' and its role in creating vulnerability, as well as the use of psychological tactics in intelligence and political agendas. We also cover the manipulation techniques used in propaganda, brainwashing, and influence and explore the impact of cognitive biases, the power of visual imagery, and the illusion of control. Finally, we talk about immunity from manipulation and the internal journey of self-awareness and humility. FREE YOUR MIND: The new world of manipulation and how to resist it. episodes.title: Guy Pearce on Cults, The Vow, Acting, Lying and Truth.
episodes.description: In this Episode: Guy Pearce talks about why he reached out to me. We had an amazing, deep, and honest conversation covering cults, groups, his fascination with The Vow, and his take on acting and being human.Guy Pearce was born October 5, 1967 in the UK to Margaret Anne and Stuart Graham Pearce. His father was born in Auckland, New Zealand, to English and Scottish parents, while Guy's mother is English. Pearce and his family initially traveled to Australia for two years, after his father was offered the position of Chief test pilot for the Australian Government. Guy was just 3-years-old. After deciding to stay in Australia and settling in the Victorian city of Geelong, Guy's father was killed 5 years later in an aircraft test flight, leaving Guy's mother, a schoolteacher, to care for him and his older sister, Tracy.Having little interest in subjects at school like math or science, Guy favored art, drama and music. He joined local theatre groups at a young age and appeared in such productions as "The King and I," "Fiddler on the Roof," and "The Wizard of Oz." In 1985, just two days after his final high school exam, Guy started a four-year stint as "Mike Young" on the popular Aussie soap Neighbours (1985). At age 20, Guy appeared in his first film, Heaven Tonight (1989), then, after a string of appearances in film, television and on the stage, he won the role of an outrageous drag queen in The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert (1994).He has amazed film critics and audiences, alike, with his magnificent performances in L.A. Confidential (1997), Memento (2000), The Proposition (2005), Factory Girl (2006), The Hurt Locker (2008), The King's Speech (2010) and the HBO mini-series, Mildred Pierce (2011). Next to acting, Guy has had a life-long passion for music and songwriting.Support the showWebsite: www.markvicente.comInstagram: https://www.instagram.com/markvicente/Twitter: https://twitter.com/markvicenteFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/markvicente/Theme Music: "In Time" by Kollen

episodes.title: The 4th "F" (FAWNING) with Dr. Ingrid Clayton
episodes.description: In this episode: Have you ever felt ashamed of how you went along with an abuser for months, maybe even years, even though a part of you knew the situation was toxic? That's known as FAWNING. This episode will help demystify that very normal trauma response. Dr. Ingrid Clayton will help us to understand the 4 F's (Fight, Flight, Freeze and FAWN) while discussing her own story and aspects of the NXIVM Cult.Ingrid Clayton, PhD is a writer and clinical psychologist in private practice in Los Angeles, California. With a Masters in transpersonal psychology and a Ph.D. in clinical psychology, Dr. Clayton has a holistic approach to psychotherapy, incorporating trauma-informed modalities like Somatic Experiencing, EMDR, and other experiential ways of working with the nervous system. She is the author of the memoir: Believing Me: Healing from Narcissistic Abuse and Complex Trauma, where she uncovers her personal experience of childhood trauma from a psychologist’s perspective and Recovering Spirituality: Achieving Emotional Sobriety in Your Spiritual Practice. Ingrid is a regular contributor to Psychology Today , where her article, “What is Self-Gaslighting?” is considered an Essential Read.https://www.ingridclayton.com/https://www.instagram.com/ingridclaytonphd/https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3PvWTgJMirURfgHWj3h28gSupport the showWebsite: www.markvicente.comInstagram: https://www.instagram.com/markvicente/Twitter: https://twitter.com/markvicenteFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/markvicente/Theme Music: "In Time" by Kollen

episodes.title: Mike Rinder - A Billion Years
episodes.description: In this Episode, a conversation with Mike Rinder about The Vow (Season 2) and his book: A Billion Years: My Escape From a Life at the Highest Levels of ScientologyMike is a former senior executive of the Church of Scientology International (CSI) who has become a prominent whistleblower against abuses in scientology and other organizations.He is best known today for his role alongside Leah Remini in their Emmy-winning A&E TV series TV Leah Remini: Scientology and the Aftermath. Over 3 seasons and 37 episodes they exposed many shocking abuses told through the eyes of the victims. Mike was born in Australia and raised in a scientology family. He joined the organization’s elite inner core (the “Sea Org”) at age 18 and rose through the ranks, working directly with both L. Ron Hubbard and his successor David Miscavige. He has a unique insider’s perspective on scientology.From 1982 to 2007 he was a member of the Board of Directors of CSI, was the international spokesperson for scientology and also headed the Office of Special Affairs ~ overseeing the corporate, legal, public relations and spying/dirty tricks of scientology. Mike escaped from scientology in 2007 – leaving behind all his family (parents/siblings and wife/children) who “disconnected” from him. At 53, with no money, college degree, resume or support system he began a new life. Today he is happily remarried with a 10 year old son. He writes a daily blog on scientology and has recently published a memoir A Billion Years: My Escape From a Life at the Highest Levels of Scientology.Fair Game Podcast with Leah Remini and Mike RinderEpisode 11: Mark Vicente from The Vow talks NXIVM and ScientologyLeah and Mike talk to Mark Vicente about the HBO documentary series, The Vow, the similarities with Scientology and common themes of high control groups.Support the showWebsite: www.markvicente.comInstagram: https://www.instagram.com/markvicente/Twitter: https://twitter.com/markvicenteFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/markvicente/Theme Music: "In Time" by Kollen

episodes.title: (NXIVM) Letter to the Inside - Part 4 of 4
episodes.description: In this Episode: (PART 4 of 4) In March 2018 I recognized Keith Raniere was about to be arrested. Along with my fellow whistleblowers, we had spent the previous 9 months trying to get people out of NXIVM. I made one final attempt en masse to get my friends (true believers) to wake up before Raniere was arrested. I wrote a long letter to a select few friends on ‘the inside’ on March 10th, 2018 - 16 days before Keith Raniere was arrested in a Mexican Villa on March 26th, 2018. I sent it mostly to lower ranks because I knew that if I included the top of the organization, the higher ranks would have blocked it. I needed my friends who received the letter to have time to absorb what I was saying before they had to report it up the chain of command. This was my desperate attempt to try and wake my friends up before the arrests began. ~ Mark Vicente Sections of the letter: Shunning, Whistleblower, The Blame Game, The Appearance of Calm, VWEEK2016, Slavery. Remember Africa, The Enablers, Your Future Selves"Mirreyes" (my kings) https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3026433/Mirreyes-rich-kids-Mexican-elite-use-Instagram-wealth.htmlYour Future Selves. Well, my rant has come to an end. As I said, that is 0.5%. I am well aware that this LONG letter may not move any of you. Too many EM’s and The Knife. Also, some of you may be True Believers. But at least we can collectively never look back and say I didn’t express this. That I didn’t try. I am writing this hopefully to your future selves who will look back at this, maybe years from now and say HOLY SHIT! It was right in front of me!  More and more information will be disclosed that will startle many of you. At first you will be convinced it is all part of the big bad conspiracy against your beloved Lord and Master and his 'innocent’ minions. But the revelations will grow and grow and be more and more shocking. Then you will have to face the horror as well, as many of us have. It will take significant decompression and time. We will be here when that day comes. We will help you. You may never talk to me as long as you live, and you likely won’t, but do ONE thing. Read ONE book: "Take Back Your Life: Recovering from Cults and Abusive Relationships" By Janja Lalich and Madeleine Landau Tobias It will change your life. It may even save your life. I miss many of you deeply.  All my love, Mark Support the showWebsite: www.markvicente.comInstagram: https://www.instagram.com/markvicente/Twitter: https://twitter.com/markvicenteFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/markvicente/Theme Music: "In Time" by Kollen

Raniere succeeds in fulfilling his sadistic need to enslave others through a kind of battering, his twisted rationales convincing followers, and not just the women, that self-torture and torture of others builds character.  In fact, what he does is utterly self-serving, exploiting others entirely to feed the delusion of his own omnipotence. Those who have been brainwashed with Raniere's hateful ideas about women will need time to free themselves from their conditioning, to be able to respect and trust themselves again."  ~ Daniel Shaw, LCSWSupport the showWebsite: www.markvicente.comInstagram: https://www.instagram.com/markvicente/Twitter: https://twitter.com/markvicenteFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/markvicente/Theme Music: "In Time" by Kollen

episodes.title: (NXIVM) Letter to the Inside - Part 1 of 4
episodes.description: In this Episode: (PART 1 of 4) In March 2018 I recognized Keith Raniere was about to be arrested. Along with my fellow whistleblowers, we had spent the previous 9 months trying to get people out of NXIVM. I made one final attempt en masse to get my friends (true believers) to wake up before Raniere was arrested. I wrote a long letter to a select few friends on ‘the inside’ on March 10th, 2018 - 16 days before Keith Raniere was arrested in a Mexican Villa on March 26th, 2018. I sent it mostly to lower ranks because I knew that if I included the top of the organization, the higher ranks would have blocked it. I needed my friends who received the letter to have time to absorb what I was saying before they had to report it up the chain of command. This was my desperate attempt to try and wake my friends up before the arrests began. ~ Mark Vicente Sections of the letter: Grab a glass of wine, An Unspoken Credo, The Illuminati, Pam’s Death, Sudden Disappearance?, Multiple Attempts I began my  "Whistleblower Blog' on my website a few days before the New York Times broke the explosive article on October 17th, 2017 (Exactly 5 years before 'The VOW - Part II airs on HBO) It was my attempt to leave breadcrumbs for my friends who were trying to figure out what was going on. These are the links to the blog I referenced in the letter:(Read my blog starting on Episode 1 to understand ‘word-salad’) Episode 1 & 2 below: http://www.markvicente.com/whistleblower/2017/10/12/how-the-bleep-did-that-happen-episode-1 http://www.markvicente.com/whistleblower/2017/10/17/how-the-bleep-did-that-happen-episode-2 I didn’t realize at the time I was caught in what I now understand as 'Stage 7'.  You can read about it on my blog: http://www.markvicente.com/whistleblower/2017/10/24/how-the-bleep-did-that-happen-episode-9 "At this stage, some people try to reason with the leaders. They will either arrange for visits or write long agonizing letters. Some hope that they can change the system or get some to agree with them. They are AMAZED at the total inability of leaders to hear what they are saying. However, some will agree with their arguments, pat them on the head and try to smooth their ruffled feelings." Support the showWebsite: www.markvicente.comInstagram: https://www.instagram.com/markvicente/Twitter: https://twitter.com/markvicenteFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/markvicente/Theme Music: "In Time" by Kollen

episodes.title: Episode 3 - Spiritual Bypassing
episodes.description: In this episode: What is Spiritual Bypassing? The problem with 'being above it all'. Dissociating from difficult feelings. Robert Augustus Masters write a book on Spiritual Bypassing, then abused his students. Toxic positivity protects abusers. The inability to acknowledge darkness. Teachers who haven't dealt with their psychological shit. Creating a kind of hell for yourself because you're not allowed to feel human. No compassion for self or others. Magically changing timelines to another reality? The only way 'out' is in. At 'Rock Bottom' you can't pretend anymore. Spiritual Bypassing: When Spirituality Disconnects Us From What Really MattersSpiritual bypassing—the use of spiritual practices/beliefs to avoid dealing with painful feelings, unresolved wounds, and developmental needs—is so pervasive that it goes largely unnoticed. In the tradition of the landmark book Cutting Through Spiritual Materialism by Chögyam Trungpa, Spiritual Bypassing casts a lucidly critical eye on our deeply entrenched misuse of spirituality, furthering the body of psychological/spiritual insight into how we use (and abuse) spirituality. https://www.robertmasters.com/book/spiritual-bypassing/Robert Augustus Masters: Clarifying My PastFrom 1986 to 1994 I led an experimental psychospiritual community that gradually became a cult. I called myself its guide but was more its director and centerpiece. More often than I’d like to admit, I was arrogant, aggressive, and misused my power, and those in the community paid the price for this. Everyone was caught up in my dream of a new kind of tribalism. https://www.robertmasters.com/about-robert/robert-augustus-masters-clarifying-my-past/Spiritual bypassing, Christian bypassing, Stoic bypassing https://www.philosophyforlife.org/blog/spiritual-bypassing-christian-bypassing-stoic-bypassingSupport the showWebsite: www.markvicente.comInstagram: https://www.instagram.com/markvicente/Twitter: https://twitter.com/markvicenteFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/markvicente/Theme Music: "In Time" by Kollen

episodes.title: Episode 2 - F*ck Adversity
episodes.description: In this episode: Getting into the cold ocean and disillusionment with the principle of "pushing against adversity". The ESP/NXIVM Credo to overcome the body and vilify comfort. Satiation was deemed weak and unprincipled. An entire intensive dedicated to proving that true love = the ability to withstand pain. Calorie counting and skinniness are a requirement for virtue and nobility.  And finally, redefining pushing against adversity and embracing the suck. Beware of the intent of the leader pushing you to relinquish your instinct.Support the showWebsite: www.markvicente.comInstagram: https://www.instagram.com/markvicente/Twitter: https://twitter.com/markvicenteFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/markvicente/Theme Music: "In Time" by Kollen
